intro: Racosperma ayersianum, commonly known as the Ayers' wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant is typically shrub-like, with slender stems and small, oval-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands and heathlands. Racosperma ayersianum plays a role in nitrogen fixation, contributing to soil fertility in its native habitat.
